sen.e: Mimimotoji or Mimomonotoji (date of birth and death unknown) lived in the Asuka period.
Mimimotoji, also referred to as Mimomonotoji (year of birth and death unknown) was a female who lived in the Asuka period.

sen.e: Mimimotoji, also referred to as Mimomonotoji (year of birth and death unknown) was a female who lived in the Asuka period.

sen.j: 弘文天皇の妃の一人であったとされている。
sen.e: She is considered to be as one of Emperor Kobun's wives.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』『藤氏家伝』などの同時代史料には全く記載が無く、『本朝皇胤紹運録』に弘文天皇（大友皇子）の妃となり壱志姫王を産んだと伝えられている。
sen.e: Descriptions recorded in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and "Toshi Kaden" (Biographies of the Fujiwara clan) and "Honcho koin jounroku" (the Emperor's family tree, made in the Muromachi period) reported that she married with Emperor Kobun (Prince Otomo) and gave birth to Ichishihime no Okimi.

There is no description about her in those historical materials of the same period such as "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and "Toshi Kaden" (Biographies of the Fujiwara clan), and the "Honcho koin jounroku" (the emperor's family tree, made in the Muromachi period) reports that she married the Emperor Kobun (the Prince Otomo) and gave birth to Ichishihime no Okimi.
sen.cmt: 文前半を文脈に応じて修正しました。スペースを修正しました。the を補いました。Emperor's→emperor's,reported→reports,married with→married と修正しました。
sen.e: There is no description about her in those historical materials of the same period such as "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and "Toshi Kaden" (Biographies of the Fujiwara clan), and the "Honcho koin jounroku" (the emperor's family tree, made in the Muromachi period) reports that she married the Emperor Kobun (the Prince Otomo) and gave birth to Ichishihime no Okimi.

sen.j: 同時代史料には全く名前が出てこないため実在を疑問視する意見もある。
sen.e: Her existence has been in question since no documentation in that period mentioned her.

sen.e: There is an opinion which questions her existence since no documentation in that period mentioned her.

sen.e: There is an opinion which questions her existence since no documentation in that period mentioned her.

sen.j: しかし『懐風藻』に「鎌足が娘の一人を大友皇子の妃とした」という記述があることから見て、鎌足の娘で大友皇子妃となった人物がいたことは間違いがないとされる。
sen.e: But there is no doubt that there was a person show was a daughter of Kamatari and wife of Prince Otomo since Kaifusou (Fond Recollections of Poetry) Kaifusou (Fond Recollections of Poetry) reported "Kamatari made one of his daughters a wife of Emperor Kobun (Prince Oto).

sen.e: But there is no doubt that there was a person who was a daughter of Kamatari and became the wife of the Prince Otomo, since "Kaifuso" (Fond Recollections of Poetry) describes as 'Kamatari made one of his daughters a wife of the Emperor Kobun' (the Prince Oto).

sen.j: 壬申の乱以後の消息は全く不明。
sen.e: She disappeared completely after the Jinshin war.

sen.e: However, there are couple of shrines and temples where there have been legends that she escaped from Omo no miya to Chiba prefecture.
